result.execSummary:
All charges against Jesse J. Steeber in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse J. Steeber is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J. Steeber

1:06 PM Defendant Jesse J. Steeber appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gerard M Werner appeared by video for Jesse J. Steeber.  Prosecuting attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
The case is dismissed and read in. Defendant plead to charge(s) in 21CF789.
E-mail correspondence confirming defendant's appearance from Racine Correctional.
Plea date on October 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Criminal Complaint returned as undeliverable. Unable to forward. Remailed with possible offender number on 9-2-2022.

3:07 pm - Defendant Jesse J. Steeber appeared by video, in custody, at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Gerard M Werner appeared by video for Jesse J. Steeber.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial. Inducement contained in email dated 08-22-22.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Further proceedings on September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a preliminary hearing on 08-24-22 at 2:30 p.m. Br. 2.
Copy filed.
Warrant canceled and original returned to Clerk's office.

Copies of criminal complaint mailed to defendant at Dodge Correctional.
Clerk also contacted PD's office informing them that the Court would like them to contact deft at Dodge and sign him up for representation on this matter.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

1:36 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse J. Steeber appeared by video, in custody, at Dodge Correctional Institution.  Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender. Court will have JA contact public defender's office to have them reach out to defendant to get signed up.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing. The warrant in this matter is quashed.  Defendant wishes to appear in person at the preliminary hearing.  Court sets bail at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant refused to sign.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
2:19 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse J. Steeber not in court. State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.

Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 01-13-22.   
Initial appearance is set for 04-11-22 at 1:30 p.m.
